canonical_explanation.text: Force is a push or a pull that can change the state of motion or shape of an object. Types of forces include muscular force (from our muscles), gravitational force (Earth pulling objects down), frictional force (opposes motion between surfaces), and magnetic force (between magnets). Force can start motion, stop motion, change speed, change direction, or change shape. Energy is the ability to do work. Types of energy include heat, light, sound, electrical, and mechanical energy. The Sun is the main source of energy. Energy can change from one form to another (e.g., electrical to light in a bulb). Energy sources can be renewable (sun, wind, water) or non-renewable (coal, oil, gas).
rules: Force is a push or pull
Muscular force comes from our muscles
Gravitational force pulls objects toward Earth
Force can start, stop, change speed/direction, or change shape
Energy is the ability to do work
Types of energy: heat, light, sound, electrical, mechanical
Sun is the main source of energy
Energy can change from one form to another
Renewable sources can be replaced; non-renewable cannot

questions.question_text: Force is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Force is a push or a pull that can change the motion or shape of an object. This is the correct definition of force, as it describes the action that force can have on objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Force is not a type of energy, like heat or light. It is also not a kind of matter, like solids, liquids, or gases. Force is also not a state of rest - it is the action that causes an object to start moving, stop moving, or change its motion. The correct answer is that force is a push or a pull that can affect an object.

questions.question_text: When you push a toy car, you are using:
questions.explanation_correct: When you push a toy car, you are using your muscles to apply a force to the car. This is called muscular force, which is a type of force that can change the motion of an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravitational force is the force that pulls objects down towards the Earth, like when you drop something. Magnetic force is the force between magnets, and frictional force is the force that opposes the motion of an object. None of these are the type of force you use to push a toy car - that is muscular force, which comes from your muscles.

questions.question_text: The force that pulls objects toward the Earth is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The force that pulls objects toward the Earth is called gravity. Gravity is the force that the Earth uses to pull all objects down towards its center.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Friction is the force that opposes the motion between two surfaces. Magnetism is the force between magnets. Muscular force is the force generated by our muscles. None of these are the force that pulls objects toward the Earth - that is the force of gravity.

questions.question_text: The force that slows down a moving ball on the ground is:
questions.explanation_correct: The force that slows down a moving ball on the ground is friction. Friction is the force that opposes the motion between two surfaces, in this case, the ball and the ground. Friction acts against the motion of the ball, causing it to slow down.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is friction. Gravity is the force that pulls objects down towards the Earth, but it does not slow down the motion of the ball. Magnetic force only acts between magnetic objects, and it does not apply to a non-magnetic ball on the ground. Muscular force is the force generated by our muscles, which is not involved in the motion of the ball on the ground.

questions.question_text: A magnet attracts iron nails using:
questions.explanation_correct: Magnets attract iron nails using magnetic force. This is a special kind of force that only magnets can produce, which pulls the iron nails towards them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Gravitational force is the force that pulls objects down towards the Earth, like how an apple falls from a tree. Frictional force is the force that opposes motion between two surfaces, like when you rub your hands together. Muscular force is the force from our muscles that allows us to move and lift things. Magnets use a special magnetic force to attract iron objects like nails, not these other types of forces.

questions.question_text: Force can:
questions.explanation_correct: Force can start, stop, or change the motion of objects. It can make objects move, stop moving, or change their speed and direction. This is because force can apply a push or pull on objects to change their state of motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Force does not just move objects or just stop objects. It can do both, as well as change the speed and direction of motion. Force is a push or pull that can affect the state of motion of an object. It is not limited to only moving or only stopping objects.

questions.question_text: Pressing clay into a different shape shows that force can:
questions.explanation_correct: Pressing clay into a different shape shows that force can change the shape of an object. When you apply force by pressing on the clay, it changes from one shape to another, demonstrating how force can alter the form or appearance of things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pressing clay into a different shape does not show that force can start or stop motion, or change the color of an object. Changing the shape of an object is one of the main ways that force can affect things. When you apply force to the clay, it allows you to mold it into a new shape, which is the correct answer here.

questions.question_text: Energy is:
questions.explanation_correct: Energy is the ability to do work, like moving or changing things. It's not a type of matter, a force, or just a type of fuel - it's the power that can make things happen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Energy is not a type of matter, which is the stuff that makes up all objects. It's also not a kind of force, which is a push or pull that can change an object's motion or shape. And energy is not just a type of fuel, like coal or oil - it's the ability to do work that can come from many different sources, including renewable ones like the sun and wind.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a form of energy?
questions.explanation_correct: Heat is a form of energy. Energy is the ability to do work, and heat is one type of energy that can be used to do work, like warm up a room or cook food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water, rock, and air are not forms of energy. They are materials or substances that may contain or be affected by energy, but they are not energy themselves. Heat, on the other hand, is a form of energy that can be used to do work.

questions.question_text: A moving car has:
questions.explanation_correct: A moving car has mechanical energy because it has both kinetic energy (energy of motion) and potential energy (energy due to its position or height). The car's engine provides the force to make it move, giving it mechanical energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The moving car does not have sound energy or light energy. Sound energy is the energy of sound waves, and light energy is the energy of light. The car has mechanical energy, which is the energy of motion and position, not sound or light.

questions.question_text: The main source of energy on Earth is:
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun is the main source of energy on Earth. The Sun produces a huge amount of energy through nuclear reactions, and this energy reaches the Earth in the form of heat and light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sun is the main source of energy on Earth. The Sun produces a huge amount of energy through nuclear reactions, and this energy reaches the Earth in the form of heat and light. The Moon, stars, and wind are not the primary sources of energy on Earth. The Moon reflects the Sun's light, and the stars are distant suns. Wind is a form of energy, but it is not the main source of energy on Earth.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a renewable source of energy?
questions.explanation_correct: Sunlight is a renewable source of energy because it comes from the Sun, which will continue to provide energy for a very long time. Unlike coal, oil, and natural gas which will eventually run out, the Sun will keep shining and providing energy that we can use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coal, oil, and natural gas are not renewable sources of energy because they are formed from the remains of plants and animals that lived millions of years ago. Once these fossil fuels are used up, they cannot be replaced. The Sun, on the other hand, is a renewable source of energy that will keep providing us with energy for a very long time.

questions.question_text: Coal, oil, and gas are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Coal, oil, and gas are called non-renewable resources because they cannot be replaced easily once they are used up. They are formed from the remains of plants and animals that lived millions of years ago, and it takes a very long time for new sources to be created.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coal, oil, and gas are not renewable resources. Renewable resources are those that can be replenished or replaced naturally, such as the sun, wind, and water. Coal, oil, and gas are non-renewable because they take millions of years to form and cannot be replaced quickly once they are used up.

questions.question_text: Why does a ball thrown upward come back down?
questions.explanation_correct: The ball comes back down because of the force of gravity. The Earth's gravitational force pulls the ball back down to the ground. This is why objects always fall back down when thrown or dropped up in the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The ball does not come back down because of friction, magnetism, or wind. Friction is a force that slows down moving objects, but it does not pull objects down. Magnets only attract magnetic materials, not all objects. Wind can push objects, but it does not pull them down from the sky. The real reason is the force of gravity from the Earth, which pulls the ball back down.

questions.question_text: Shoes with rough soles help us walk without slipping because they increase:
questions.explanation_correct: Shoes with rough soles help us walk without slipping because the rough surface increases the friction between the shoes and the ground, which helps us grip the surface better and prevents us from slipping.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) Friction. Friction is the force that opposes the movement between two surfaces. The rough soles of the shoes increase the friction between the shoes and the ground, which helps us walk without slipping. The other options, A) Gravity, C) Speed, and D) Weight, do not directly relate to why shoes with rough soles help us walk without slipping.

questions.question_text: A goalkeeper catches a football and stops it. This shows that force can:
questions.explanation_correct: The goalkeeper catching the football and stopping it shows that force can stop motion. When the goalkeeper catches the ball, the force applied by their hands stops the ball's motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The goalkeeper catching the football does not make the object disappear. It simply stops the ball's motion, which is one of the things force can do. Force can also start motion, change speed, and change direction, but it cannot make objects disappear.

questions.question_text: A cricket bat hitting a ball changes the ball's direction. This is because force can:
questions.explanation_correct: When a cricket bat hits a ball, the force applied by the bat changes the direction of the ball's motion. This is because force can change the direction of an object's movement, not just its speed or shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cricket bat hitting the ball does not just increase or decrease the ball's speed, or only change the ball's shape. The force applied by the bat actually changes the direction of the ball's motion. This means the correct answer is that force can change the direction of motion.

questions.question_text: A light bulb converts electrical energy into:
questions.explanation_correct: When electricity flows through a light bulb, it converts electrical energy into both light energy and heat energy. This is because the electrical energy heats up the filament inside the bulb, causing it to glow and produce light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A light bulb does not convert electrical energy into sound energy or mechanical energy. Sound energy is created by vibrations, and mechanical energy is the energy of moving objects. Instead, the light bulb uses the electrical energy to produce light and heat energy, which is why option B is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Windmills use which source of energy?
questions.explanation_correct: Windmills use the energy from the wind to generate electricity. Wind is a renewable source of energy, which means it can be used over and over again without running out.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Windmills do not use coal, oil, or gas as their source of energy. These are non-renewable energy sources that come from the ground and will eventually run out. Windmills use the renewable energy of the wind blowing to spin their blades and generate electricity.

questions.question_text: Oil is put on bicycle chains to:
questions.explanation_correct: Oil is put on bicycle chains to reduce friction between the chain and the gears. Friction makes it harder for the chain to move smoothly, so reducing friction makes the bicycle easier to pedal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Oil is not put on bicycle chains to make the chain heavier, make it look shiny, or increase friction. Oil helps reduce the friction between the chain and the gears, which makes the bicycle easier to pedal and move.

questions.question_text: When you eat food, you get energy to run and play. Food gives us:
questions.explanation_correct: Food provides chemical energy that our bodies can use to run, play, and do other activities. The energy in food comes from the chemical bonds in the nutrients like carbohydrates, proteins, and fats.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Food does not give us light, sound, or electrical energy. These types of energy come from other sources like the sun, vibrations, and batteries. The energy from food is in the form of chemical energy, which our bodies can use to power our movements and activities.

questions.question_text: A parachute slows down a falling person by increasing:
questions.explanation_correct: The parachute increases air resistance (friction) on the falling person, which slows them down. The parachute creates a large surface area that pushes against the air as the person falls, reducing their speed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The parachute does not increase gravity, which is the force that pulls objects towards the Earth. It also does not increase the person's speed or weight. The parachute slows the person down by increasing the air resistance or friction on the person as they fall.

questions.question_text: Why should we use solar energy instead of coal?

options.text: Solar energy is renewable and doesn't cause pollution

questions.explanation_correct: Solar energy is renewable, which means it can be used again and again without running out. It also doesn't cause any pollution, unlike coal which releases harmful gases when burned.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Solar energy is a better choice than coal because it is renewable and clean. Coal is a fossil fuel, which means it will eventually run out, and when it is burned, it releases pollution that is bad for the environment. Solar energy, on the other hand, comes from the sun and can be used over and over again without causing any harm to the environment.

questions.question_text: Without friction, what would happen when you try to walk?
questions.explanation_correct: Without friction, you would slip and fall because there would be no force to help you grip the ground and walk. Friction is the force that allows you to walk, run, and move without sliding around.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If there was no friction, you would not be able to walk properly. You would just slip and fall because your feet would not be able to grip the ground. Friction is an important force that helps us walk and move around without sliding or falling.

questions.question_text: Which statement about energy is correct?

options.text: Energy can be created from nothing
Energy can only exist in one form
Energy can change from one form to another

questions.explanation_correct: Energy can change from one form to another, such as from electrical energy to light energy in a light bulb or from heat energy to mechanical energy in a car engine. This is because energy can be converted from one type to another, but it cannot be created or destroyed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Energy cannot be created from nothing. It already exists in different forms, such as heat, light, sound, electrical, and mechanical energy. Energy can also be converted from one form to another, like from electrical energy to light energy in a light bulb. However, energy cannot be used up completely or disappear.

questions.question_text: Which requires force?
questions.explanation_correct: Opening a door requires a force to be applied to it, either by pushing or pulling it. This is because the door is stationary and needs a force to start it moving or change its shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Looking at a book, thinking about homework, and listening to music do not require a force. These are mental activities that do not involve physical movement or change in an object's shape. Only opening a door requires a force to be applied to it in order to move it or change its shape.

questions.question_text: A speaker converts electrical energy into:
questions.explanation_correct: A speaker converts electrical energy into sound energy. Speakers use electrical signals to vibrate their diaphragm, which creates sound waves that we can hear.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A speaker does not convert electrical energy into light energy or heat energy only. Light energy is produced by light bulbs, and heat energy is produced by things like ovens and heaters. Speakers create sound energy, not mechanical energy like moving parts.

questions.question_text: Ice skating is easier than walking on concrete because ice has:
questions.explanation_correct: Ice has less friction than concrete, so it is easier to slide and skate on ice than to walk on concrete. The smooth surface of ice allows you to glide and move more easily compared to the rough and uneven surface of concrete.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ice does not have more friction than concrete. In fact, ice has a very smooth surface, which means there is less friction between your feet and the ground. This makes it easier to slide and skate on ice compared to the rough surface of concrete, which has more friction and makes it harder to move around.

questions.question_text: Hydroelectric power plants use the energy of:
questions.explanation_correct: Hydroelectric power plants use the energy of moving water to generate electricity. The flowing water spins a turbine, which then turns a generator to produce electrical energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hydroelectric power plants do not use the energy of sunlight, coal, or wind to generate electricity. Instead, they use the energy of moving water, which is a renewable energy source. The flowing water in rivers or dams is used to spin a turbine, which then turns a generator to produce electrical energy.

questions.question_text: When you squeeze a rubber ball, it changes shape. When you let go, it goes back to its original shape. This shows:
questions.explanation_correct: When you squeeze a rubber ball, the force from your hands changes the shape of the ball temporarily. When you let go, the ball goes back to its original shape, showing that force can change the shape of an object, but the change is not permanent.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B is correct because force can change the shape of an object temporarily. The other options are incorrect - force can change both the direction and shape of an object, not just one or the other. The ball also has energy stored inside it, which allows it to return to its original shape, so option D is also wrong.

questions.question_text: Force is a push or pull.
questions.explanation_correct: Force is a push or a pull that can change the way an object moves or its shape. This is the definition of force, so the statement 'Force is a push or a pull' is true.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students may think that force is not a push or a pull, but something else. However, the definition of force is clearly a push or a pull that can affect how an object moves or changes shape. So the statement 'Force is a push or a pull' is correct.

questions.question_text: Gravity pushes objects away from Earth.
questions.explanation_correct: Gravity is a force that pulls objects towards the Earth. It does not push objects away from the Earth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravity is a force that pulls objects towards the Earth. It does not push objects away from the Earth. This is because the Earth's gravity is an attractive force, not a repulsive force. Objects on Earth are pulled downwards by the Earth's gravity, not pushed upwards.

questions.question_text: Friction opposes motion.
questions.explanation_correct: Friction is a force that opposes the motion of an object. When an object is moving, friction acts in the opposite direction, slowing it down. This is why friction opposes or goes against the motion of an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people may think that friction helps motion, but that is not correct. Friction actually works against the motion of an object, slowing it down. Friction is a force that goes in the opposite direction of the object's motion, making it harder for the object to keep moving.

questions.question_text: Force can only start motion, not stop it.
questions.explanation_correct: Force can not only start motion, but also stop it. For example, when you push a ball, you are applying a force that starts the motion. When you apply the force in the opposite direction, it stops the motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not true that force can only start motion, and not stop it. Force can actually do both. When you push an object, the force starts its motion. But when you apply a force in the opposite direction, it will stop the motion of the object. Force can also change the speed and direction of an object's motion.

questions.question_text: Energy is the ability to do work.
questions.explanation_correct: Energy is the ability to do work, which means it can make things move or change. This is why the statement 'Energy is the ability to do work' is true.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students might think that energy is just about things like electricity or fuel. But energy is actually the ability to make things happen, like moving objects or changing their shape. So the statement 'Energy is the ability to do work' is correct.

questions.question_text: The Sun is the main source of energy on Earth.
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun is the main source of energy on Earth because it provides the energy that powers most of the processes on our planet. The Sun's energy reaches the Earth in the form of light and heat, which are used by plants, animals, and other living things to survive and grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sun is not the only source of energy on Earth. There are also other sources of energy, such as wind, water, and fossil fuels. However, the Sun is the primary source of energy that powers most of the processes on our planet, so the statement 'The Sun is the main source of energy on Earth' is true.

questions.question_text: Coal and oil are renewable sources of energy.
questions.explanation_correct: Coal and oil are not renewable sources of energy because they take millions of years to form and once they are used up, they cannot be replaced easily. Renewable sources like the sun, wind, and water can be used over and over again.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coal and oil are not renewable sources of energy. They are made from the remains of plants and animals that lived millions of years ago. Once we use up all the coal and oil, we cannot easily make more of them. Renewable sources like the sun, wind, and water can be used again and again.

questions.question_text: Energy can change from one form to another.
questions.explanation_correct: Energy can change from one form to another because energy can be converted. For example, the energy from the sun can be converted into electrical energy, which can then be used to power a light bulb and produce light energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Energy cannot change from one form to another. This is incorrect because energy can be transformed from one type to another. For example, the energy from the sun can be converted into electrical energy, which can then be used to power a light bulb and produce light energy.

questions.question_text: Smooth surfaces have more friction than rough surfaces.
questions.explanation_correct: Rough surfaces have more friction than smooth surfaces. Friction is the force that opposes the movement between two surfaces. Rough surfaces have more tiny bumps and grooves, which create more friction to stop the movement.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smooth surfaces may seem like they have less friction, but this is not true. Smooth surfaces actually have more friction than rough surfaces. This is because the tiny bumps and grooves on rough surfaces help reduce the contact area between the two surfaces, which leads to less friction.

questions.question_text: Force can change both the speed and direction of a moving object.
questions.explanation_correct: Force can change both the speed and direction of a moving object. For example, when you push a ball, the force changes its speed and makes it move in a different direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Force can change both the speed and direction of a moving object. Some people may think that force can only change the speed of an object, but that's not true. Force can also change the direction of a moving object. For example, when you kick a ball, the force from your foot changes both the speed and direction of the ball.

questions.question_text: Force is a _____ or pull.
questions.explanation_correct: Force is a push or a pull that can change the state of motion or shape of an object. The question asks what a force is, and the correct answer is 'push', because a force is a push or a pull that can affect an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'push'. Force is not a pull, it is a push or a pull that can change the state of motion or shape of an object. The question is asking what a force is, and the accepted answer format is 'push'.

questions.question_text: The force that pulls objects toward Earth is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The force that pulls objects toward the Earth is called gravity. Gravity is a force that exists between all objects with mass, pulling them towards each other. The Earth's gravity is what keeps us and all other objects on the surface from floating away into space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'gravity'. Gravity is the force that pulls objects towards the Earth. It is not 'muscular force', 'frictional force', or 'magnetic force'. Gravity is the force that makes objects fall down to the ground instead of floating away.

questions.question_text: The force that opposes motion between surfaces is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The force that opposes motion between surfaces is called friction. Friction is the force that acts between two surfaces that are in contact and trying to move past each other. It slows down or stops the motion of objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'friction' is correct. Friction is the force that opposes motion between surfaces. When two surfaces rub against each other, friction acts to slow down or stop the motion. Other types of forces, like muscular force or gravitational force, do not specifically oppose motion between surfaces.

questions.question_text: _____ is the ability to do work.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer 'Energy' is correct because energy is the ability to do work. This means that energy allows us to move and change things, like when we use energy to lift an object or turn on a light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer should be 'Energy', not 'Force'. Force is a push or a pull that can change the motion or shape of an object, while energy is the ability to do work. Energy comes in different forms like heat, light, and electricity, and it is what allows us to make things happen.

questions.question_text: The _____ is the main source of energy on Earth.
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun is the main source of energy on Earth because it releases a huge amount of energy in the form of heat and light. This energy from the Sun powers many processes on Earth, like photosynthesis in plants and weather patterns.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sun is not the only source of energy on Earth. While the Sun is the main source, there are also other sources of energy like wind, water, and fossil fuels. However, the Sun is the correct answer as it provides the most significant amount of energy that powers life and processes on our planet. The Sun is the 'accepted answer' in the correct format.

questions.question_text: A magnet attracts iron using _____ force.
questions.explanation_correct: A magnet attracts iron objects because it exerts a magnetic force on them. This force is called the magnetic force, which is one of the four main types of forces in nature.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'magnetic' force. Magnets can attract iron objects because they produce a magnetic field, which exerts a magnetic force on the iron. This force is different from other types of forces like muscular force, gravitational force, or frictional force.

questions.question_text: Coal, oil, and gas are _____ sources of energy.
questions.explanation_correct: Coal, oil, and gas are non-renewable sources of energy because they are limited in supply. This means they cannot be replaced once they are used up, unlike renewable sources like the sun, wind, and water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coal, oil, and gas are not renewable sources of energy. Renewable sources can be replenished or replaced, like the sun, wind, and water. Non-renewable sources like coal, oil, and gas are limited in supply and cannot be replaced once used up. Therefore, the correct answer is that coal, oil, and gas are non-renewable sources of energy.

questions.question_text: A moving object has _____ energy.
questions.explanation_correct: A moving object has mechanical energy because its motion gives it the ability to do work. Mechanical energy is the energy an object has due to its motion or position.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'mechanical' energy. A moving object has mechanical energy, which is the energy it has because it is in motion. This is different from other types of energy like heat, light, or sound energy. The mechanical energy of a moving object is based on its speed and mass.

questions.question_text: When you lift a book, you use _____ force from your muscles.
questions.explanation_correct: When you lift a book, you use muscular force from your muscles to pick it up. Muscular force is the force that comes from the movement of your muscles to move or lift objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'muscular' force. This is because when you lift a book, it is the force from your muscles that allows you to pick it up and move it. The other types of forces, like gravitational, frictional, or magnetic force, are not involved in lifting the book in this case.

questions.question_text: Wind, sunlight, and water are _____ sources of energy.
questions.explanation_correct: Wind, sunlight, and water are renewable sources of energy. This means that they can be used over and over again without running out, unlike non-renewable sources like coal, oil, and gas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wind, sunlight, and water are not non-renewable sources of energy. Non-renewable sources are those that will eventually run out, like coal, oil, and gas. The correct answer is 'renewable' because wind, sunlight, and water can be used again and again without getting used up.

questions.question_text: A light bulb converts electrical energy into _____ energy.
questions.explanation_correct: A light bulb converts electrical energy into light energy. This is because the electrical energy from the power source flows through the filament inside the light bulb, causing it to heat up and glow, producing light energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'light'. The correct answer is light because a light bulb uses electrical energy to power the filament inside, which then heats up and glows, producing light energy. The light bulb does not convert electrical energy into other forms of energy like heat or sound.

questions.question_text: Force can start motion, stop motion, change speed, change direction, or change _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'shape' because force can change the shape of an object. For example, if you push on a ball, the force can change its shape and make it slightly squished. Force can change the shape or form of an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'shape'. While force can start motion, stop motion, change speed, and change direction, it can also change the shape of an object. For example, if you squeeze a rubber ball, the force from your hands changes the shape of the ball. So the correct answer is 'shape', not any of the other options.

questions.question_text: Arrange the effects of force when pushing a stationary ball:
ordering_items: Ball eventually stops due to friction
correct_answer: Ball eventually stops due to friction
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Ball is at rest, Force is applied to ball, Ball starts moving, Ball eventually stops due to friction. This is because when a ball is at rest, you need to apply a force to make it start moving. Once it's moving, it will eventually stop due to the friction between the ball and the surface it's rolling on.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Ball starts moving, Force is applied to ball, Ball is at rest, Ball eventually stops due to friction. This is wrong because the ball can only start moving after a force is applied to it. The ball cannot be at rest after it has already started moving. The correct order shows the logical sequence of what happens when you push a stationary ball.

questions.question_text: Arrange the energy changes in a torch:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Chemical energy in battery, Switch is pressed, Electrical energy flows, Light energy comes out. This is because the chemical energy stored in the battery is used to generate electrical energy when the switch is pressed. The electrical energy then gets converted into light energy that comes out of the torch.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Switch is pressed, Electrical energy flows, Chemical energy in battery, Light energy comes out. This is not correct because the chemical energy in the battery is the source that provides the electrical energy, which then gets converted to light energy. The switch must be pressed first to allow the electrical energy to flow from the battery.

questions.question_text: Arrange these surfaces from least friction to most friction:
questions.explanation_correct: Ice has the least amount of friction, so it would slide the easiest. Sandpaper has the most friction, so it would have the most resistance to sliding.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order from least to most friction is actually: Ice, Carpet, Sandpaper. Ice is very smooth and slippery, so it has the least friction. Carpet has more friction than ice, but less friction than rough sandpaper.

questions.question_text: Arrange from renewable to non-renewable energy sources:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from renewable to non-renewable energy sources is Solar energy, Coal, and Natural gas. Solar energy is a renewable source that comes from the Sun, while coal and natural gas are non-renewable fossil fuels that take millions of years to form.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order is: Coal, Solar energy, Natural gas. Coal and natural gas are non-renewable energy sources that come from fossil fuels, while solar energy is a renewable source from the Sun. The correct order from renewable to non-renewable is: Solar energy, Coal, Natural gas.

questions.question_text: Arrange what happens when a cricket bat hits a ball:
ordering_items: Ball changes direction due to force
correct_answer: Ball changes direction due to force
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Bowler throws ball toward batsman, Bat applies force to ball, Ball changes direction due to force, Ball flies in new direction. This is because the bowler first throws the ball, then the bat applies a force to the ball, which changes the ball's direction, and finally the ball flies in the new direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Ball flies in new direction, Bowler throws ball toward batsman, Bat applies force to ball, Ball changes direction due to force. This is wrong because the ball can't fly in a new direction before the bat applies a force to it, and the bat can't apply a force to the ball before the bowler throws it.
